title: Assessing lineage and cytolytic functional potential of murine tissue-resident innate lymphocytes
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Generation and analysis of fate-mapped mice
Timing: 8 weeks total: 2–3 days generating S1pr5FM chimeras, 4–6 weeks to age mice, 1–2 days to analyze fate-mapped mice
This major step allows for analysis of fate-mapping of immune cells by S1pr5 and granzyme C (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A). S1pr5 expression is associated with recirculation and mature NK cells, and thus S1pr5FM+ cells are currently or are derived from circulating NK cells. Granzyme C expression is associated with tissue-resident ILC1 cells, and thus GzmcFM+ cells are currently or are derived from resident ILC1s. Given the leakiness of S1pr5eGFP-iCre in some mice during development upstream of hematopoiesis, an additional step generating bone marrow chimeras via transfer of non-fate mapped Lineage-Sca1+cKit+ (LSK) cells, which include the hematopoietic stem cells, is required, whereas GzmcFM mice can be analyzed directly.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2507-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Experimental outlines and schematics
(A) General steps involved in the generation and analysis of fate-mapped mice.
(B) General steps involved in the ILCp transfer and analysis experiment.
(C) General steps involved in the ex vivo killing assay experiment.
Generate S1pr5FM bone marrow chimeras. First, select S1pr5FM mice with minimal leaky FM expression in peripheral blood to use as bone marrow donors.
Note: It can be difficult to predict the required ratio of donor to recipient mice given that the range of stochastic S1pr5FM expression in the LSK compartment can range from 0% to 99% depending on the donor mouse. Thus, checking the peripheral blood can be a good way to ensure use of donor mice with as little non-specific fate mapping as possible, as the percentage of YFP expression by blood cells roughly correlates with rate of stochastic Cre expression/fate mapping in bone marrow LSKs.

Collect blood (less than 50 μL) via tail vein nick of potential bone marrow donor mice (S1pr5FM mice).
Warm mouse by putting under heat lamp for 5 min.
Place mouse in restrainer and wipe tail with alcohol wipe.
Create small nick on tail vein at distal end of tail with a disposable scalpel.
Collect blood with a heparinized capillary tube.
Place capillary tube with blood into 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube pre-filled with 5 μL 0.1 M EDTA to prevent clotting.
Wrap mouse tail with paper towel and apply pressure at point of nick to stop bleeding before returning mouse to cage.
Flush blood from capillary tube by pipetting ∼800 μL red blood cell (RBC) lysis buffer into top of capillary tube, collecting it into Eppendorf tube below.
Let sit for 5 min at 20°C–25°C.
Transfer to 15 mL conical tube, add 5 mL chilled PBS, and spin down tube for 6 min at 550 rcf and 4°C.
Discard supernatant and resuspend cells in 100 μL FACS buffer.
Transfer sample through piece of nylon mesh material into 1.2 mL polypropylene microtiter tube.
Run sample on LSR-II with FSC, SSC, FITC and PE channels recording.
Analyze data using FlowJo software, gating on cells based on morphology, and measuring YFP expression (S1pr5FM) which should be expressed in both the FITC and PE channels.
Note: Accurate S1pr5 fate-mapping should be expressed only in patrolling monocytes and NK cells in the blood, which should be below 10% of cells. Choose donor mice with the lowest level of non-specific fate mapping in the blood to ensure highest number of FM-negative LSKs during sort.
Lethally irradiate (900 rad) recipient CD45.1+ C57BL/6 mice 12–24 h before cell transfer.
Isolate bone marrow from femur and tibia of S1pr5FM (CD45.2+) donor mice.

Remove muscle, put clean bones in 70% ethanol for 1–2 min, rinse in sterile PBS.
Mash bones using mortar and pestle in sterile biological safety cabinet.
Collect bone marrow in T cell media (TCM), and pass it through 70 μm filter to get single cell suspension.
Prepare and stain cells from bone marrow for cell sorting.
Deplete lineage cells from bone marrow using the EasySep™ Mouse Hematopoietic Progenitor Cell Isolation Kit, following the manufacturer’s instructions, using Magnetic Bead Selection Kit buffer.
Transfer resulting cells to 15 mL conical tubes and spin down tubes for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf. Decant supernatant.
Stain cells with surface antibodies.
Resuspend cells in ∼500 μL (50 μL per 1 × 106 cells) FACS buffer with 1 μg per 50 μL Fc Block, viability dye, and antibodies against surface proteins conjugated to compatible fluorochromes.
Note: Sample antibody panel for LSK sort: FcBlock (1 μg per 50 μL), FITC – open for detection of YFP, CD45 – PerCPCy5.5 (1:200), Lineage ([all 1:200]: B220 – Pacific Blue, CD11b – Pacific Blue, CD3 – Pacific Blue, F4/80 Pacific Blue, TER119 – Pacific Blue, Streptavadin – BV421 to react with unbound biotinylated lineage antibodies from depletion kit), c-Kit – APC (1:200), viability dye (Tonbo GhostDye) – Violet 510 (1:1000), Sca1 – PE-Cy7 (1:200).
Incubate cells plus antibody cocktail for 30 min on ice, protected from light.
Wash cells by adding 5 mL cold PBS to conical tube. Spin down cells for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf. Remove supernatant.
Repeat wash two more times for a total of three washes.
Resuspend cells in sorting buffer at a cell concentration of 20 × 106 cells per mL for use with a 70 μm nozzle on the FACSAria sorter.

Transfer samples through piece of nylon mesh material into 5 mL polypropylene test tube.
Sort for non-fate mapped LSKs, on BD FACSAria, gating on live CD45+Lin-Sca1+c-Kit-S1pr5FM- cells (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]), and as displayed in Nixon et al.1[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1] Sort into 1 mL sort collection medium in 15 mL conical tube.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2507-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Sorting strategy for non-fatemapped LSK (Lineage-Sca1+cKit+) cells from S1pr5FM mouse bone marrow
Critical: The gating strategy during the sort needs to be precise. The sorter needs to have been properly calibrated for the experiment, with appropriate compensation controls run. After compensation, it can be helpful to record a small part of the sample to use to draw gates before collecting cells. If the gating is not precise and some fate-mapped LSKs are inadvertently included, this can lead to incorrect interpretation of the fate-mapping experiment.
Transfer at least 5,000 sorted non-fate-mapped LSKs per recipient mouse.
Resuspend sorted sample in 100 μL sterile PBS per 5,000 cells.
Inject 100 μL intraveneously, via either tail vein or retroorbital injection, into irradiated recipient mice.
Maintain recipient mice on chow supplemented with the antibiotics sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim (sulfatrim diet) for at least two weeks post-irradiation as their immune system reconstitutes.
Age mice for 4-6 weeks to allow immune system to reconstitute before analysis.
Analyze cellular phenotype of S1pr5FM chimeras and GzmcFM mice. Euthanize adult S1pr5FM chimeras 4–6 weeks post-transfer and adult GzmcFM mice and harvest tissues of interest, including blood, spleen, and liver.
Process tissues to get single-cell suspensions for downstream flow cytometric analysis.
Harvest and process blood.
Harvest blood via cardiac puncture and put in 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes with 50 μL 0.1 M EDTA to prevent coagulation.
Spin down Eppendorf tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Resuspend pellet in 1 mL RBC lysis buffer.

Transfer to 15 mL conical tube and let sit for 5 min at 20°C–25°C.
Add 5 mL chilled PBS and spin down for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Resuspend in T cell media. Keep on ice until ready for staining.
Harvest and process the spleen.
Mash tissue between two glass slides in 2 mL chilled PBS in a 60 × 15 mm tissue culture dish.
Pass mashed tissue through 70 μm cell strainer into 50 mL conical tube, mashing tissue with the flat end of 3 mL syringe plunger through strainer.
Transfer cells to 15 mL conical tube.
Spin down tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in 5 mL RBC lysis buffer. Let sit for 5 min at 20°C–25°C.
To wash, add 5 mL chilled PBS and spin tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in ∼5 mL T cell media. Keep on ice until ready for staining.
Harvest and process the liver.
Chop organ with razor blade on glass slide.
Place minced tissue in 15 mL conical tube with 5 mL HBSS w/o Ca2+, Mg2+ + 1 mg/mL Collagenase D.
Vortex for 5 s, incubate in 37°C water bath for 30 min, vortexing every 15 min.
Pass digested tissue through 70 μm cell strainer into 50 mL conical tube, mashing tissue with the flat end of 3 mL syringe plunger through strainer.
Rinse strainer with 15 mL PBS.
Spin down tubes for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Remove supernatant and resuspend in 7 mL 44% Percoll.
Transfer cells + 44% Percoll to 15 mL conical tube.
Slowly add 3 mL 66% Percoll to bottom of tube, do not disturb interface.

Critical: when creating Percoll gradient, make sure 66% layer and 44% layer are fully separated with a clear interface between the two layers. Adding 66% slowly is key to keeping the layers separate.
Spin samples for 30 min at 4°C and 1,900 rcf without brake.
To wash away Percoll, collect cells at the interface and transfer to a new 15 mL conical tube.
Bring up volume to 15 mL with chilled PBS.
Vortex well to make sure no Percoll interface re-forms.
Spin down tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf. Decant supernatant.
Critical: Make sure to vortex tube well before spin to ensure Percoll is fully mixed into wash. After spin and before decanting supernatant, inspect tube to make sure cells are pelleted at the bottom of the tube, not at a re-formed Percoll interface.
Stain single-cell suspensions of tissues for flow cytometric analysis.
Plate samples into 96 well U-bottom plates for staining, no more than 1 × 106 cells per well.
Stain cells with antibodies against surface proteins.
Spin down samples on plate for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf.
Dump supernatant and resuspend each sample in 50 μL FACS buffer with 1 μg FcBlock, viability marker, and antibodies against surface proteins conjugated to compatible fluorochromes (see note for sample panel).
Note: Sample panel including surface and intracellular (“intra”) proteins for fate map analysis by flow cytometry: FcBlock (1 μg per 50 μL), anti-GFP raised in rabbit (primary intra, 1:200), anti-rabbit Fc - FITC (secondary intra, 1:200), CD45.2 – vf450 (1:100), CD45.1 - APC (1:100), NK1.1 - APC-Cy7 (1:100), GzmC - PE-Cy7 (intra) (1:300), CD49b - PE-CF594 (1:200), CD3 - BV510 (1:200), GhostDye – Violet 510 (1:1000), CD45 - BV605 (1:200), and CD49a - BV711 (1:200).
Incubate for 30 min on ice protected from light.

Add 150 μL chilled FACS buffer, spin down samples for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf and remove supernatant.
Wash twice with FACS buffer by spinning down samples for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf, dumping supernatant and resuspending in 200 μL FACS buffer for each wash.
Fix and permeabilize cells.
Resuspend samples in 100 μL Fix/Perm.
Incubate for 30 min on ice protected from light.
Add 150 μL Fix/Perm buffer to each well and spin samples down for 3 min at 4°C and 860 rcf.
Wash twice with Fix/Perm buffer by removing supernatant, resuspending cells in 200 μL Fix/Perm buffer and spinning down samples for 3 min at 4°C and 860 rcf for each wash.
Stain cells with antibodies against intracellular proteins.
Resuspend samples in 50 μL Fix/Perm buffer that contains intracellular antibodies (see note above for sample antibody panel).
Incubate for 30 min on ice protected from light.
Add 150 μL Fix/Perm buffer to each well and spin plate down for 3 min at 4°C and 860 rcf. Remove supernatant.
Wash twice with Fix/Perm buffer by removing supernatant, resuspending each sample in 200 μL Fix/Perm buffer and spinning the plate down for 3 min at 4°C and 860 rcf for each wash.
If secondary intracellular antibody is required, repeat steps 10.d.i-iv with appropriate antibody.
Pause point: Once cells are fixed, you can leave them at 4°C protected from light for up to 24 h before performing intracellular staining or before running on flow cytometer.
After staining is complete, resuspend samples in 100 μL FACS buffer and pass samples through piece of nylon mesh material into 1.2 mL polypropylene microtiter tube before running on analyzer.
Run samples on flow cytometer (i.e., BD LSR-II or Fortessa), including appropriate compensation controls.
Analyze samples using FlowJo software.

ILCp transfer and analysis
Timing: 5 weeks total: 1 day to transfer ILCp, 4 weeks to age mice, 1–2 days to analyze
This step involves transferring precursor populations and analyzing what cell populations they can differentiate into, specifically querying whether ILCps can give rise to granzyme C-expressing ILC1-phenotype cells (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B). The ILCp can give rise to innate lymphoid cells (ILCs) but not to NK cells.3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3],4[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib4]
Note: For optimal ILCp harvest, it is important to use young mice, 4–6 weeks old. Older mice have fewer ILCps. Because ILCp are so rare, 6 donor mice or more are needed to isolate sufficient ILCp for one recipient mouse.
Sort ILCp from CD45.1+ C57BL/6 donor mice.
Harvest bone marrow from tibia, femur and humerus bones from ∼6 week old mice, 6 donor mice per recipient mouse, as described in step 3.
Stain bone marrow for cell sorting.
Deplete Lineage+ cells as described in steps 4a and 4b.
Resulting cells will be in a 15 mL conical tube.
Spin cells down and stain cells by resuspending pellet in ∼500 μL (1 × 106 cells per 50 μL) FACS buffer with FcBlock, viability dye, and fluorescently conjugated antibodies.
Note: Sample antibody panel for ILCp sort: FcBlock (1 μg per 50 μL), PD-1 - FITC (1:200), α4β7 - PerCPCy5.5 (1:100), Lineage ([all 1:200]: B220 – Pacific Blue, CD11b – Pacific Blue, CD3 – Pacific Blue, F4/80 Pacific Blue, TER119 – Pacific Blue, Streptavadin – BV421), Tonbo GhostDye – Violet 450 (1:1000), Flt3 - APC (1:50), NK1.1 - APC-Cy7 (1:100), CD127 - PE (1:50), CD25 - PE-Cy7 (1:100).
Stain for 30 min on ice protected from light.
After staining, add 5 mL FACS buffer to the tube. Spin tube down for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Discard supernatant.
Resuspend pellet in 5 mL FACS buffer.

Spin down tubes for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Discard supernatant.
Repeat vii – ix for additional wash.
Resuspend in sorting buffer volume to achieve a concentration of 20 × 106 cells per mL when using a 70 μm nozzle on the sorter.
Pass through piece of nylon mesh material into 5 mL polypropylene test tube before sort.
Sort for ILCp.
Sort sample on Aria II using 70 μm nozzle with the following gating strategy: Live, lineage-NK1.1-CD127+α4β7+Flt3-PD-1+CD25-, as displayed in Figure S3F from Nixon et al.1[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]
Sort into 1 mL sort collection medium in 15 mL conical tube.
Critical: The gating strategy during the sort needs to be precise. The sorter needs to have been properly calibrated for the experiment, with appropriate compensation controls run. After compensation, it can be helpful to record a small part of the sample to use to draw gates before collecting cells. If the gating is not precise, then the experimenter may inadvertently include other precursor populations in the sort, leading to inconclusive and/or inaccurate findings.
Transfer around 4,000 ILCp to each recipient mouse.
Resuspend sorted sample in 100 μL sterile PBS per 4,000 cells.
Inject 100 μL intraveneously, via either tail vein or retroorbital injection, into irradiated recipient mice.
Analyze recipient mice after ∼4 weeks.
Euthanize recipient mice and harvest organs of interest, including spleen and liver.
Process tissues, stain single cell suspension with antibodies recognizing surface and intracellular proteins, run on flow cytometer and analyze data, as detailed in previous major steps 9–12.

Note: Sample panel including surface and intracellular (“intra”) proteins for ILCp transfer analysis by flow cytometry: FcBlock (1 μg per 50 μL), CXCR6 – BV421 (1:200), CD49a – aF647 (1:200), NK1.1 - APC-Cy7 (1:100), GzmC - PE-Cy7 (intra) (1:300), CD49b - PE-CF594 (1:200), GhostDye – Violet 510 (1:1000), CD45 - BV605 (1:200), CD45.1 – BV650 (1:100), and CD3 - BV711 (1:200).
Ex vivo killing assay
Timing: 2 weeks total; 1 day sorting effector cells, 1 week expanding effectors, 2 days killing assay
This major step addresses whether liver ILC1 that do or do not currently express granzyme C in vivo based on tdTomato expression have the potential to kill RMA-S target cells, and whether this killing activity requires perforin (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C).
Harvest and prepare liver immune cells.
Euthanize GzmctdT-iCre/+ and GzmctdT-iCre/+Prf1−/− mice. Harvest organs of interest, i.e., liver.
Process liver to get single cell suspension for downstream cell sorting (see major step 9c.).
Stain cells for sorting.
Resulting cells will be in 15 mL conical tube from isolation after Percoll spin and wash.
Resupend pellet in appropriate volume (50 μL per 1 × 106 cells) FACS buffer with a viability dye and fluorescently conjugated antibodies against surface proteins.
Note: Sample antibody panel for cell sorting of ILC1 subsets: FcBlock (1 μg per 50 μL), CXCR6 – BV421 (1:200), CD49a - aF647 (1:200), NK1.1 - APC-Cy7 (1:100), Blank PE (for tdTomato), CD3 - BV510 (1:200), GhostDye – Violet 510(1:1000), and CD45 - BV605 (1:200).
Incubate on ice for 30 min protected from light.
To wash, add 5 mL FACS buffer to the tube. Spin tube down for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Discard supernatant.
Resuspend pellet in 5 mL FACS buffer.
Spin down tubes for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Discard supernatant.

Repeat iv – vi for an additional wash.
Resuspend in sorting buffer volume to achieve a concentration of 20 × 106 cells per mL when using a 70 μm nozzle on the sorter.
Pass sample through nylon mesh material into 5 mL polypropylene test tube before sort.
Sort cells on FACSAria.
Collect GzmctdT+ and GzmctdT- ILC1 (Live CD45+NK1.1+CXCR6+CD3-CD49a+) from Prf1+/+ and Prf1−/− mice, as displayed in Figure S11A from Nixon et al.1[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]
Sort into 1 mL sorting collection medium in 15 mL conical tubes.
Critical: The gating strategy during the sort needs to be precise. The sorter needs to have been properly calibrated for the experiment, with appropriate compensation controls run. After compensation, record a small part of the sample to use to draw gates before collecting cells. If the gating is not precise, then the experimenter may be including other cell populations in the sort without realizing it, leading to inconclusive and/or inaccurate findings.
Spin down sorted samples for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Resuspend pellet in TCM containing 100 ng/mL murine IL-15/IL-15rα complex at appropriate cellular concentration of up to 50,000 cells per 200 μL (per well).
Plate 200 μL of sorted cells per well of 96 U-bottom plate.
Incubate and expand sorted effector cells at 37°C in incubator for 7 days, refreshing media and IL-15/IL-15rα complex after 3–4 days.
Prepare RMA-S target cells on day of killing assay.
Select confluent dish(es) of RMA-S cells.
Remove media and wash dish twice with 10 mL PBS.
Add 3 mL trypsin And incubate for 5 min in 37°C incubator.
Pipette cells and trypsin up and down, passing over surface of dish a few times to remove adherent cells.

Transfer cells and trypsin to 15 mL conical tube. Wash dish with TCM and add to tube, bringing volume up to 15 mL.
Spin down tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Remove supernatant.
Stain RMA-S cells with CellTrace Violet (CTV) dye.
Resuspend CTV tube in 20 μL DMSO.
Add 1 μL CTV to 1 mL PBS.
Resuspend cells in 1 mL PBS.
Add 1 mL PBS + CTV to cells and pipette up and down to mix (total volume of 2 mL).
Incubate in 37°C water bath for 15 min.
Bring volume up to 15 mL with TCM that had been warmed in the water bath.
Spin down tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Resuspend pellet in 10 mL warmed TCM.
Spin down tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Resuspend pellet in 10 mL warmed TCM and incubate in water bath for 10 min to ensure all unbound CTV is absorbed.
Take 10 μL aliquot for counting.
Spin down tube for 6 min at 4°C and 550 rcf.
Count live RMA-S cells.
Mix 10 μL 0.4% trypan blue with 10 μL CTV-stained RMA-S cells.
Let sit 3 min at 20°C–25°C.
Pipette 10 μL underneath coverslip of hemacytometer.
Placing hemacytometer on brightfield microscope, count number of cells that have not taken up the dye (live cells) in each of the four outer quadrants.
Calculate number of live cells in sample: (number of cells in four quadrants/4) × (104) = number of cells per mL, then (number of cells per mL) × (total volume of cells [in mL]) for final cell number.
Resuspend RMA-S in appropriate volume of TCM + 100 ng/mL IL-15/IL-15rα as needed for killing experiment.

Plate 10,000 live target cells in 100 μL per well in a 96 well U-bottom plate.
Prepare effector cells on day of killing assay.
Determine volume of media in each well of effector cells.
Note: Although each well was originally plated with 200 μL media, some media may have evaporated and the total volume may have decreased, thus changing the cell number calculation.
Take small aliquot (10 μL) from each well to count expanded effector cell populations.
Count cells as detailed in steps 23i.
Spin down plate of cultured effector cells.
Resuspend cells in proper volume of TCM + 100 ng/mL IL-15/IL-15rα to achieve concentration of 100,000 cells per 100 μL.
Note: Other conditions with effector:target ratios of 3:1 and 1:1 can also be included if there are sufficient numbers of cells.
Initiate killing assay by adding 100 μL (100,000) effector cells to wells with 100 μL (10,000) target cells, bringing total volume to 200 μL.
Include wells with target cells only to determine background death rate in target cells.
Incubate for 16 h in 37°C incubator.
Spin down plate for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf, discard supernatant, and resuspend in 200 μL PBS plus EDTA to break apart cell conjugates and end killing assay.
Spin down plate for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf, discard supernatant, and resuspend cells in 50 μL PBS with viability dye (i.e., Tonbo GhostDye).
Incubate on ice for 30 min protected from light.
Add 150 μL FACS buffer to each well.
Spin down plate for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf and discard supernatant.
Resuspend cells in 200 μL FACS buffer.
Spin down plate for 3 min at 4°C and 700 rcf, and discard supernatant.
Repeat steps 32 and 33 for additional wash.

Resuspend samples in 100 μL FACS buffer and pass through nylon mesh material into 1.2 mL microtiter tube.
Run cells immediately on flow cytometer to measure death of target cells.
Analyze data on FlowJo software, gating on CTV+ cells to identify target cells and then determining the percentage of target cells that died based on viability dye expression (Figure 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig5]).
